description: Contradiction laws deal with expressions involving FALSE. A contradiction is always false regardless of other values. "P and FALSE" always equals FALSE (since FALSE makes the entire conjunction false). "P or FALSE" simplifies to just P (since FALSE doesn't add anything). These laws help simplify expressions with constant falsehood.
rule_pattern: P ∧ FALSE ⊢ FALSE, P ∨ FALSE ⊢ P

problems.solution: Apply Contradiction law: P and FALSE is always FALSE since FALSE makes the conjunction false.
